content.raw:
Sorry to keep picking at this, but you still need to update the value of `iter`.  Otherwise, after erasing one, you'll come back through the loop and try to dereference it.  I suggest that you assign to it the return value from `erase()`, which will be the [new location of the element that previously followed the element that you erased](http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/vector/vector/erase/), like so:

~~~
iter = this->wrenchDurations.erase(iter);
~~~
content.html:
Sorry to keep picking at this, but you still need to update the value of iter. Otherwise, after erasing one, you'll come back through the loop and try to dereference it. I suggest that you assign to it the return value from erase(), which will be the new location of the element that previously followed the element that you erased, like so:

iter = this->wrenchDurations.erase(iter);
